tracer.paths

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • tracer.paths.Path
      • tracer.paths.Shape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants, Drawable

    public class Shape
extends Path
    A sequence of vertices attached by lines, analogous to using Processing's beginShape(), vertex(), and endShape() functions.
    Author:
    James Morrow [jamesmorrowdesign.com]

      • getGap

        public float getGap(int i)
        Description copied from class: Path
        Gives the ith discontinuity in the Path as a 1D coordinate. Gaps should be unique and indexed in ascending order. In other words, this must hold true: gap(i) < gap(i+1) as i varies from 0 to getGapCount()-1. Gives -1 if the index is valid.
        Specified by:
        getGap in class Path
        Parameters:
        i - The index
        Returns:
        The ith discontinuity as a value within [0, 1)

      • blend

        public static Shape blend(Path a,
                          Path b,
                          float amt,
                          int sampleCount)
        Blends two Paths and makes a Shape.
        Parameters:
        a - The first Path
        b - The second Path
        amt - A value from 0 to 1, determining how much to weight Path b over Path a.
        sampleCount - The number of sample points to use
        Returns:
        The Shape

        public static Shape toShape(Path path,
                            int sampleCount,
                            float offset)
        Converts an arbitrary type of Path into a Shape, using a given sampleCount, with its starting point offset by a one-dimensional coordinate.
        Parameters:

        sampleCount - The number of sample points to use
        offset - The one-dimensional coordinate
